WorkItem.ClosedComment: Resolved by renaming the file with the appropriate extension
WorkItem.Description:
I have a 180+kb xls file (with formulas, styles and macros) which I read 
([code]
$file = PHPExcel_IOFactory::load('invoices/xls/testFile03.xls');
[/code]), change some values and the try to write to the browser as a 'Save File' prompt.
 
I tried saving the (source) file as Excel 5, and then using the Excel5 writer it works out fine (less some styles, macros and formulas).
If I use the Excel2007 writer (with the original source file), the resulting file is corrupted, if I use the Excel5 writer I get a blank page on the browser and no 'Save File' prompt window.
 
I'm using PHP 5.2.11 on linux
Apache/2.2.3 (CentOS) 
Zend Framework 1.8.3
PHPExcel 1.7.2
OpenOffice 3.2.0
 
Many thanks
WorkItem.Summary: Excel2007 Writer returns a corrupt file

Comments.Message:
Your file has an xls (Excel5) extension, but the content is xlsx (Excel2007), and opens correctly in Excel 2003 with the campatibility pack if the extension is changed to xlsx. I'll need to wait till this evening before I can try it with Excel2007.
Try using the Excel2007 writer with the correct extension (and headers) and see whether it works for you.
